Title: Why Doesn’t Health Insurance Cover Dental and Vision, Too? (melmagazine.com)
Content: This same stigma has also led to a perception that dental and vision problems are perhaps less serious than “medical” ones, and therefore should be kept separate. (Some people may also mistakenly feel like dental problems are a personal problem that has to do with your own lapses in dental hygiene, whereas medical problems can affect everyone.) But this is a questionable stance: More than 50,000 people will be diagnosed with oral cancer this year. Research has demonstrated links between periodontal infections and chronic conditions, like diabetes and cardiovascular disease. Surely, tons of people end up in the ER because of accidents caused by them not being able to see well enough. And what about all the people who lose out on opportunities because they have a missing tooth?

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Doesn’t Health Insurance Cover Dental and Vision, Too? (melmagazine.com)
Content: That aside, one of the main reasons why our eyes and teeth are ignored by most health-care plans has to do with history and stigma. For one, dentistry and medicine have long been considered to be distinctly different practices. Until the 1800s, barbers served as unsophisticated dentists, pulling teeth and piercing abscesses after giving you a nice, close shave. As time went on, dentistry (and ophthalmology, to some degree) was regarded as less advanced than medicine, which seeped into the minds of Congress while they formulated public health insurance policies in the 1960s. As just one example of the general sentiment during those times, in 1940, an appellate court in New York decided that dentists weren’t doctors, and thus not deserving of the same prestige.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Doesn’t Health Insurance Cover Dental and Vision, Too? (melmagazine.com)
Content: That aside, one of the main reasons why our eyes and teeth are ignored by most health-care plans has to do with history and stigma. For one, dentistry and medicine have long been considered to be distinctly different practices. Until the 1800s, barbers served as unsophisticated dentists, pulling teeth and piercing abscesses after giving you a nice, close shave. As time went on, dentistry (and ophthalmology, to some degree) was regarded as less advanced than medicine, which seeped into the minds of Congress while they formulated public health insurance policies in the 1960s. As just one example of the general sentiment during those times, in 1940, an appellate court in New York decided that dentists weren’t doctors, and thus not deserving of the same prestige.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Doesn’t Health Insurance Cover Dental and Vision, Too? (melmagazine.com)
Content: This same stigma has also led to a perception that dental and vision problems are perhaps less serious than “medical” ones, and therefore should be kept separate. (Some people may also mistakenly feel like dental problems are a personal problem that has to do with your own lapses in dental hygiene, whereas medical problems can affect everyone.) But this is a questionable stance: More than 50,000 people will be diagnosed with oral cancer this year. Research has demonstrated links between periodontal infections and chronic conditions, like diabetes and cardiovascular disease. Surely, tons of people end up in the ER because of accidents caused by them not being able to see well enough. And what about all the people who lose out on opportunities because they have a missing tooth?

claim: 运输稀有、珍贵且不可替代的文物须先制定详尽的安全与保护方案，博物馆通常动用多名搬运专家并“非常非常谨慎”地操作
question_src: 如何运输稀有，有价值的，不可替代的博物馆文物？
all_claims: 运输稀有、珍贵且不可替代的文物须先制定详尽的安全与保护方案，博物馆通常动用多名搬运专家并“非常非常谨慎”地操作[4]。
对国际（及部分国内）运输，所有承运人、货运、海关经纪人等必须经馆方批准，并使用指定经纪公司办理通关手续[2]。
高价值或极易损文物往往需由馆员或外部快递员全程陪同，监督拆装、重新包装，并在途中配备专门安全护送，费用由借方承担[3]。
此外，捷克学者将埃及发现的文物运至布拉格时即实行“严格的安全措施”，凸显高安全级别的重要性[1]。
环境控制同样关键：运输温度宜维持约65 °F（约18 °C），并严格控湿以抑制霉菌与微生物生长[5]。
若车辆无法恒温，应以隔热材料、移动毯增加保温，并为每件文物预留空间、定制坐架或托盘，避免摩擦与震动[5]。
随行的鉴定文件亦需防潮并置于文件盒、文件夹中妥善固定[5]。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Valuable artefacts from Egypt transported to Prague’s National Museum (english.radio.cz)
Content: Dozens of artefacts discovered by Czech archaeologists in Egypt’s Abusir have been transported under strict security measures to the National Museum in Prague.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Artifact Loan Procedures and Requirements (airandspace.si.edu)
Content: All transportation (carrier, customs brokerage, freight forwarding, additional security, storage, travel between venues, etc.) associated with transit from and to NASM, and between venues, must be approved by NASM, with all costs borne by the Borrower. The use of an approved customs brokerage firm is required to coordinate the shipping of all international loans and may be required for certain domestic loans.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Artifact Loan Procedures and Requirements (airandspace.si.edu)
Content: If a courier is required, the Borrower will be responsible for all courier costs and any and all unforeseen expenditures required to assure the safe transport and installation of the lent artifacts as well as the transport of the courier. NASM retains the right to require that a loan be accompanied by a NASM staff courier (or outside contracted individual) and that unpacking, mounting, installation, de-installation, and repacking be supervised by the courier at the Borrower’s expense. Types of lent artifacts that generally require the aid of a courier include, but are not limited, to those possessing unique conservation concerns (such as spacesuits), highly fragile artifacts, artifacts that require specialized knowledge for installation or handling, and artifacts with high monetary or scholarly values. In addition to a courier, certain high value artifacts may require the use of specialized security escorts during transit.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: 博物馆如何移动文物？ - 方牛摩尔河（Squarecowmovers.com）
Content: 标题中问题的简短答案是 - 非常非常谨慎。由于展览经常发生变化，因此博物馆必须运送许多珍贵的，文化上重要的物品。除了无价的文物外，许多博物馆的作品非常精致，不适合标准包装盒。移动任何类型的人工制品都是一项巨大的工作，需要多个移动专家。
---
Document ID: 5
Title: How Do Museums Move Artifacts? - Square Cow Moovers (squarecowmovers.com)
Content: Moisture is the biggest cause of weather damage to artifacts. The slightest bit of humidity can damage items made of plant and animal materials. If the relative humidity is off it can also increase the chance of mildew and microbial growth.


Temperature is also a concern. Extreme cold and hot temperatures could compromise some items. Moving in the spring or fall is a preferred time in some areas since the weather is usually more temperate. The ideal temperature for many artifacts is 65 degrees Fahrenheit.


Climate has to be controlled at every stage, including short-term storage. If the truck containing the piece isn’t insulated during transport, consider how it can be packaged to provide extra insulation. Moving blankets are an excellent way to provide extra padding and insulation.


### Give Items Plenty of Space


Packing strategically is important anytime you move, but for museum quality pieces ample space is often needed. Instead of cramming everything in together like sardines to save space, heirlooms, artifacts and artwork may actually benefit from extra space.


If there’s any chance that friction or contact could damage a museum piece it’s placed in a crate or special packaging. Museums have even had to construct mounts, trays and supports to stabilize artifacts before they’re moved. When that’s not possible, the item is adequately secured in place and given plenty of room in the moving truck.


### Special Packaging for Documents


Even the documentation that authenticates a historical artifact or art piece is a vital item that has to be handled and packed with care. When you’re moving files moisture is again a top concern, but physical damage can also easily occur if documents aren’t packaged appropriately.


File boxes are designed to securely hold thousands of letter or legal size documents. File folders can also be used in the boxes to keep documents in order without causing any damage.


### Limit Light and UV Exposure
---

Title: How Do Museums Move Artifacts? - Square Cow Moovers (squarecowmovers.com)
Content: Moisture is the biggest cause of weather damage to artifacts. The slightest bit of humidity can damage items made of plant and animal materials. If the relative humidity is off it can also increase the chance of mildew and microbial growth.


Temperature is also a concern. Extreme cold and hot temperatures could compromise some items. Moving in the spring or fall is a preferred time in some areas since the weather is usually more temperate. The ideal temperature for many artifacts is 65 degrees Fahrenheit.


Climate has to be controlled at every stage, including short-term storage. If the truck containing the piece isn’t insulated during transport, consider how it can be packaged to provide extra insulation. Moving blankets are an excellent way to provide extra padding and insulation.


### Give Items Plenty of Space


Packing strategically is important anytime you move, but for museum quality pieces ample space is often needed. Instead of cramming everything in together like sardines to save space, heirlooms, artifacts and artwork may actually benefit from extra space.


If there’s any chance that friction or contact could damage a museum piece it’s placed in a crate or special packaging. Museums have even had to construct mounts, trays and supports to stabilize artifacts before they’re moved. When that’s not possible, the item is adequately secured in place and given plenty of room in the moving truck.


### Special Packaging for Documents


Even the documentation that authenticates a historical artifact or art piece is a vital item that has to be handled and packed with care. When you’re moving files moisture is again a top concern, but physical damage can also easily occur if documents aren’t packaged appropriately.

### Limit Light and UV Exposure

Content: 水分是天气损害工件的最大原因。一点点的湿度会损害动植物材料制成的物品。如果相对湿度脱离，它也会增加霉菌和微生物生长的机会。


温度也是一个问题。极端寒冷和炎热的温度可能会损害某些物品。在某些地区，在春季或秋季移动是首选时间，因为天气通常更温和。许多伪影的理想温度为65度华氏度。


气候必须在每个阶段受到控制，包括短期存储。如果在运输过程中没有隔热的卡车，请考虑如何包装以提供额外的绝缘材料。移动毯子是提供额外填充和绝缘材料的绝佳方法。


###给物品足够的空间


无论您搬家时，战略性地包装都是重要的，但是对于博物馆的质量物品来说，通常需要足够的空间。传家宝，文物和艺术品实际上可能会从额外的空间中受益，而不是像沙丁鱼那样将所有东西塞在一起以节省空间。


如果有摩擦或接触的机会，可能会损坏放置在板条箱或特殊包装中的博物馆作品。博物馆甚至不得不建造坐骑，托盘和支撑物，以便在搬迁之前稳定文物。如果不可能，则该物品已足够固定在适当的位置，并在移动的卡车中给出了足够的空间。


###文档的特殊包装


即使是对历史文物或艺术作品进行身份验证的文档也是必须谨慎处理和包装的重要项目。当您将文件移动时，水分再次成为最大的问题，但是如果文档未适当打包，也很容易造成物理损害。


文件框旨在安全保存数千个字母或合法规模的文件。文件文件夹也可以在框中使用，以使文档保持秩序，而不会造成任何损坏。

气候必须在每个阶段受到控制，包括短期存储。如果在运输过程中没有隔热的卡车，请考虑如何包装以提供额外的绝缘材料。移动毯子是提供额外填充和绝缘材料的绝佳方法。


###给物品足够的空间


无论您搬家时，战略性地包装都是重要的，但是对于博物馆的质量物品来说，通常需要足够的空间。传家宝，文物和艺术品实际上可能会从额外的空间中受益，而不是像沙丁鱼那样将所有东西塞在一起以节省空间。


如果有摩擦或接触的机会，可能会损坏放置在板条箱或特殊包装中的博物馆作品。博物馆甚至不得不建造坐骑，托盘和支撑物，以便在搬迁之前稳定文物。如果不可能，则该物品已足够固定在适当的位置，并在移动的卡车中给出了足够的空间。


###文档的特殊包装


即使是对历史文物或艺术作品进行身份验证的文档也是必须谨慎处理和包装的重要项目。当您将文件移动时，水分再次成为最大的问题，但是如果文档未适当打包，也很容易造成物理损害。


文件框旨在安全保存数千个字母或合法规模的文件。文件文件夹也可以在框中使用，以使文档保持秩序，而不会造成任何损坏。

对国际（及部分国内）运输，所有承运人、货运、海关经纪人等必须经馆方批准，并使用指定经纪公司办理通关手续[2]。
高价值或极易损文物往往需由馆员或外部快递员全程陪同，监督拆装、重新包装，并在途中配备专门安全护送，费用由借方承担[3]。
此外，捷克学者将埃及发现的文物运至布拉格时即实行“严格的安全措施”，凸显高安全级别的重要性[1]。

question_src: 什么是“少数模特”？
all_claims: “少数模特”可译为“模范少数族裔”或“模范少数派”，是20世纪中期在美国媒体出现的概念，用来描述被公众视为“特别成功”的少数族裔群体，并常被拿来与其他少数群体对比以凸显其在教育、经济等方面的成就[1]。
在美国，这一标签最常套用于亚裔美国人，他们整体上被赞扬为勤奋、守纪、成绩优异的群体[2]。
然而专家指出，该神话将所谓的“成功”简单归因于文化因素，忽视了亚裔群体内部的阶级、文化等差异，并暗示未取得同等成就者是不够努力，从而造成伤害[4]。
同时，被贴上少数模特标签的个人往往感到必须满足这些刻板期望的压力，影响其心理健康[3]。

在美国，这一标签最常套用于亚裔美国人，他们整体上被赞扬为勤奋、守纪、成绩优异的群体[2]。

question_src: 如果我将10亿美元存入我的储蓄，银行将如何赚钱，考虑到数百万的利息？
all_claims: 若你把10 亿美元存入高收益储蓄账户，银行大概按1.5%年利率付给你1500万美元[1]；随后它将这笔资金以更高利率放贷，例如5.5%抵押贷款、6.65%学生贷款或16.99%信用卡债务[1]。
假设平均贷款利率约6%，一年即可产生约6000万美元利息收入，扣除付你的1500万，单靠利差便获利约4500万美元；若更多资金流向高息信用卡，利润还会放大。
此外，银行还向借款人收取贷款申请费，并把该费计入本金继续计息，例如100美元申请费若摊入30年抵押贷款，借款人还须再付约94美元利息[3]；同时，账户维护费和ATM费等“小额收费”也不断进账[2]。
因此，尽管你可获得“数千万级”利息，银行仍能通过更高贷款利率和多元收费，把你的10 亿美元转化为更高收益，并在全球无数类似存款中重复这一模式，实现规模化盈利[1]。
claims_retained: 若你把10 亿美元存入高收益储蓄账户，银行大概按1.5%年利率付给你1500万美元[1]；随后它将这笔资金以更高利率放贷，例如5.5%抵押贷款、6.65%学生贷款或16.99%信用卡债务[1]。
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 金融101：银行如何赚钱？ -  30岁以下的钱（www.moneyunder30.com）
Content: 这一切都与银行赚钱的基本方式联系在一起：银行使用储户的资金进行贷款。银行在贷款上收取的利息金额大于他们通过储蓄帐户向客户支付的利息金额，而差额是银行的利润。


例如：您目前有一个高收益储蓄帐户的10,000美元的紧急基金，该帐户可能会支付1.50％的APY。该银行用这笔钱为某人的资金提供资金：


*抵押贷款为5.50％APR
*学生贷款为6.65％
*信用卡位于16.99％的APR


您的银行一年内可能已经付了150美元，但他们从贷款的利息中赚了数百或数千美元（用您的钱使您的贷款成为可能）。现在，考虑一下数百万银行客户和数十亿美元的重复，请考虑一下这一过程。
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: Yes, banks make a lot of money banks from charging borrowers interest, but the fees banks change are just as lucrative.


* Account fees. Some typical financial products that charge fees are checking accounts, investment accounts, and credit cards. These fees are said to be for “maintenances purposes” even though maintaining these accounts costs banks relatively little.
* ATM fees. There will be times when you can’t find your bank’s ATM and you must settle for another ATM just to get some cash. Well, that’s probably going to cost you $3. Such situations happen all the time and just mean more money for banks.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: * Penalty charges. Banks love to slap on a penalty fee for something a customer’s mishaps. It could a credit card payment that you sent in at 5:05PM. It could be a check written for an amount that was one penny over what you had in your checking account. Whatever it may be, expect to pay a late fee or a notorious overdraft fee or between $25 and $40. It sucks for customers, but the banks are having a blast.
* Commissions. Most banks will have investment divisions that often function as full-service brokerages. Of course, their commission fees for making trades are higher than most discount brokers.
* Application fees. Whenever a prospective borrower applies for a loan (especially a home loan) many banks charge a loan origination or application fee. And, they can take the liberty of including this fee amount into the principal of your loan—which means you’ll pay interest on it too! (So if your loan application fee is $100 and your bank rolls it into a 30-year mortgage at 5% APR, you’ll pay $94.40 in interest just on the $100 fee).
---

claim: 公司进入破产程序时，100万美元债务会被列入破产财产，由破产管理人根据法定顺序用公司剩余资产（包括清算所得）向债权人分配
question_src: 如果我要创建一家公司，有100万美元的债务，破产，我欠的公司将如何获得钱？我必须付款吗？
all_claims: 公司进入破产程序时，100万美元债务会被列入破产财产，由破产管理人根据法定顺序用公司剩余资产（包括清算所得）向债权人分配[1]。
破产本身并不会自动抹掉债务，只是由法院决定如何清偿并告知债权人付款去向[1]。
在有限责任公司的正常架构下，若您既未为贷款签署个人担保，也未用个人房产作抵押，债权人通常只能从公司的资产中获得偿付，您个人无需另行付款[2]。
但如果您提供了个人担保或抵押物，一旦企业违约，债权人即可追索您的个人资产来补足欠款[2]。
此外，若公司资本不足、未遵守公司治理程序、混用公司与个人资金或存在欺诈，法院可能“刺穿公司面纱”，判定您对公司债务承担个人责任[3]。
因此，除非存在个人担保、抵押或不当经营行为，否则公司破产后债务主要由公司资产承担，您个人通常不必掏腰包。

此外，若公司资本不足、未遵守公司治理程序、混用公司与个人资金或存在欺诈，法院可能“刺穿公司面纱”，判定您对公司债务承担个人责任[3]。

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 如果一家公司倒闭，我是否欠债务？ （www.debtcollectionanswers.com）
Content: 您欠成为破产管理公司的公司的债务债务将成为破产公司资产的一部分。


但是，如果您欠一家倒闭经商的公司以及如何收集债务，则会发生什么，部分取决于债务的状况。



“公司申请破产的事实不会自动删除任何


您欠的债务。”


如果贷方正在收取债务但倒闭，您将需要继续向贷款付款，否则您可能会损害信用报告和信用评分。如果公司申请破产，则法院将指示您在哪里进行每月付款的地方。如果您对债务是否有效有任何争议，请在通知破产后立即提出争议。如果您不这样做，则债务可能被认为有效。
---
Document ID: 2
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: If you cosign on a business loan, you are as equally responsible as the corporation or LLC to pay it back. This is usually the simplest way to voluntarily make yourself liable for your company's debts. Similarly, if you personally guarantee an obligation of the corporation or LLC then the creditor can come after your personal assets if the business defaults on the loan.


## Pledging Your Property as Collateral


If you have a new company or your company does not have many assets, a creditor may require you to provide some sort of collateral before approving the loan. If you agree to pledge your house or other personal assets as collateral for the business loan, the creditor may be able to take your property and sell it to satisfy the obligations of the company.


## Piercing the Corporate Veil


Above we discussed the ways you can voluntarily make yourself personally liable for a corporate or LLC debt. However, a creditor can also try to go after your personal assets by eliminating the limited liability protection provided by the corporation or LLC. This is commonly referred to as piercing the corporate veil.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: more likely to pierce the corporate veil if:


* Corporate formalities, such as holding annual meetings and keeping minutes, were not followed.
* Certain owners exerted too much control over the corporation or LLC.
* Owners commingled personal funds with company funds or used personal funds to satisfy company obligations.
* The company was not sufficiently capitalized when it was formed.


(To learn more, see Piercing the Corporate Veil: When LLCs and Corporations May Be at Risk.)


## Fraud


A corporation or LLC's owners may also be held personally liable if they are found to have committed fraud
---

Title: If A Company Goes Out of Business Do I Owe Debt to Collection Agency? (www.debtcollectionanswers.com)
Content: The debt you owe as a debtor to a company that goes into bankruptcy administration will become part of the assets of the company in bankruptcy.


However, exactly what happens if you owe money to a company that goes out of business, and how that debt will be collected, depends in part on the status of the debt.



"The fact that a company files for bankruptcy does not automatically erase any


debt you owe."


If a lender is collecting the debt but goes out of business, you will need to continue to make payments on the loan or you risk damage to your credit reports and credit scores. If the company files for bankruptcy, the court will instruct you where to make your monthly payments if that changes. If you have any dispute over whether the debt is valid, raise that dispute as soon as you are notified of the bankruptcy. If you don’t, the debt may be considered valid.

Title: 当您对LLC或公司债务承担个人责任时（www.nolo.com）
Content: 如果您签订商业贷款，那么您与公司或有限责任公司同样负责，以偿还它。通常，这是自愿对公司债务负责的最简单方法。同样，如果您个人保证公司或有限责任公司的义务，则如果企业违约贷款违约，则债权人可以追随您的个人资产。


##将您的财产保证为抵押品


如果您有一家新公司或您的公司没有很多资产，则债权人可能要求您在批准贷款之前提供某种抵押品。如果您同意保证您的房屋或其他个人资产作为企业贷款的抵押品，则债权人可能可以将您的财产带出您的财产并出售以满足公司的义务。


##刺穿公司面纱


在上面，我们讨论了您可以自愿承担公司或有限责任公司债务的方式的方式。但是，债权人还可以通过消除公司或有限责任公司提供的有限责任保护来追求您的个人资产。这通常被称为刺穿公司面纱。

Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: more likely to pierce the corporate veil if:


* Corporate formalities, such as holding annual meetings and keeping minutes, were not followed.
* Certain owners exerted too much control over the corporation or LLC.
* Owners commingled personal funds with company funds or used personal funds to satisfy company obligations.
* The company was not sufficiently capitalized when it was formed.


(To learn more, see Piercing the Corporate Veil: When LLCs and Corporations May Be at Risk.)


## Fraud


A corporation or LLC's owners may also be held personally liable if they are found to have committed fraud

Document ID: 2
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: If you cosign on a business loan, you are as equally responsible as the corporation or LLC to pay it back. This is usually the simplest way to voluntarily make yourself liable for your company's debts. Similarly, if you personally guarantee an obligation of the corporation or LLC then the creditor can come after your personal assets if the business defaults on the loan.


## Pledging Your Property as Collateral


If you have a new company or your company does not have many assets, a creditor may require you to provide some sort of collateral before approving the loan. If you agree to pledge your house or other personal assets as collateral for the business loan, the creditor may be able to take your property and sell it to satisfy the obligations of the company.


## Piercing the Corporate Veil


Above we discussed the ways you can voluntarily make yourself personally liable for a corporate or LLC debt. However, a creditor can also try to go after your personal assets by eliminating the limited liability protection provided by the corporation or LLC. This is commonly referred to as piercing the corporate veil.
---

Title: 当您对LLC或公司债务承担个人责任时（www.nolo.com）

*没有遵循企业手续，例如举行年度会议和保留会议记录。
*某些所有者对公司或有限责任公司施加了过多的控制权。
*业主将个人资金与公司资金或使用个人资金符合公司义务。
*公司成立时没有足够的资本化。


（要了解更多信息，请参阅刺穿公司面纱：LLC和公司可能处于危险之中时。）


＃＃ 欺诈罪


如果发现有欺诈行为，公司或有限责任公司的所有者也可能会承担个人责任

claim: 要让水在低于100 ℃时沸腾，关键是降低其上方的气压：当外界气压下降到与水在某一温度下的饱和蒸汽压相等时，水分子无需再克服海平面常压即可逸出液面，于是就在这一更低温度开始剧烈汽化
question_src: 水如何煮沸100°C以下？
all_claims: 要让水在低于100 ℃时沸腾，关键是降低其上方的气压：当外界气压下降到与水在某一温度下的饱和蒸汽压相等时，水分子无需再克服海平面常压即可逸出液面，于是就在这一更低温度开始剧烈汽化[2]。
在自然环境中，海拔越高，大气压越小，因此同样加热条件下的水会在更低温度就达到沸点；例如在高山地区，人们常发现水已经“滚腾”而实测温度却明显低于100 ℃[1]。
实验室或工业上也可用真空泵抽走空气，制造低压容器，使水在室温甚至更低的温度下就能沸腾，这一原理同样源于压强降低导致沸点下降[3]。
总之，无论通过上山还是抽真空，只要把环境压力降到水在目标温度时的蒸汽压，即可让水在100 ℃以下沸腾。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What Is the Boiling Point of Water at Various Altitudes? (www.thespruceeats.com)
Content: One of the most significant changes that occur in high altitude areas concerning cooking is the boiling point of water. As the altitude increases, the atmospheric pressure pushing down on water decreases, which allows the water to boil at lower temperatures.


A lower boiling point means that food cooks at a lower temperature, despite the fact that the water is boiling. It is important to recognize just how much the temperature of boiling water is reduced as the altitude increases.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 为什么水在高海拔地区迅速沸腾？ »科学ABC（www.scienceabc.com）
Content: 当它们上方的气压较小时，水分子很容易逃脱地面。由于这是高海拔地区的天然状态，因此水的沸点减少了，因此可以达到沸腾
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Effects of Altitude on Water Boiling Time (mountainhouse.com)
Content: It also impacts the boiling point of water: the temperature at which liquid water begins turning to vapor, which occurs when its vapor pressure equals the atmospheric pressure. At a higher elevation, the lower atmospheric pressure means heated water reaches its boiling point more quickly—i.e., at a lower temperature. Water at sea level boils at 212 degrees Fahrenheit; at 5,000 feet above sea level, the boiling point is 203 degrees F. Up at 10,000 feet, water boils at 194 degrees F.

all_claims: 要让水在低于100 ℃时沸腾，关键是降低其上方的气压：当外界气压下降到与水在某一温度下的饱和蒸汽压相等时，水分子无需再克服海平面常压即可逸出液面，于是就在这一更低温度开始剧烈汽化[2]。
在自然环境中，海拔越高，大气压越小，因此同样加热条件下的水会在更低温度就达到沸点；例如在高山地区，人们常发现水已经“滚腾”而实测温度却明显低于100 ℃[1]。
实验室或工业上也可用真空泵抽走空气，制造低压容器，使水在室温甚至更低的温度下就能沸腾，这一原理同样源于压强降低导致沸点下降[3]。
总之，无论通过上山还是抽真空，只要把环境压力降到水在目标温度时的蒸汽压，即可让水在100 ℃以下沸腾。

Title: 各种高度的水的沸点是什么？ （www.thespruceeats.com）
Content: 关于烹饪的高海拔地区，发生的最重要的变化之一是水的沸点。随着海拔高度的增加，大气压力下降的水减少，这使水在较低的温度下沸腾。


较低的沸点意味着食物在较低的温度下煮熟，尽管水正在沸腾。重要的是要认识到随着海拔高度的增加，沸水温度降低了多少。

Title: Why Does Water Boil Quickly At High Altitudes? » Science ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Water molecules have an easy time escaping off the surface when the air pressure above them is less. Since this is a naturally-occurring condition in high altitude regions, the boiling point of water is reduced and thus it attains the boiling
---

Title: Effects of Altitude on Water Boiling Time (mountainhouse.com)
Content: It also impacts the boiling point of water: the temperature at which liquid water begins turning to vapor, which occurs when its vapor pressure equals the atmospheric pressure. At a higher elevation, the lower atmospheric pressure means heated water reaches its boiling point more quickly—i.e., at a lower temperature. Water at sea level boils at 212 degrees Fahrenheit; at 5,000 feet above sea level, the boiling point is 203 degrees F. Up at 10,000 feet, water boils at 194 degrees F.

question_src: 为什么接触欧洲疾病的美国原住民人口会破坏，而欧洲探险家没有抓住当地人的主要疾病？
all_claims: 欧洲人在中世纪以来的高密度城市中长期与污水混杂的饮用水相处，使致命传染病不断出现并快速进化，幸存者逐步积累了免疫力[2]；这些幸存者虽然自身无恙，仍可携带病原体远行传播[1]。
相反，美洲原住民聚居规模较小，城市稀少，缺乏能让病原体持续循环并变异的大人口池，因此历史上几乎没有类似的大流行病，也就没有相应的免疫屏障[3]。
此外，旧世界农民与牛、猪等多种家畜长期密切接触，而骑士亦与马、大象相伴，动物到人的跨种传播机会极多；新世界的可驯化大型哺乳动物极少，人畜接触有限，难以孕育对人类高度致命的新病原[4]。
于是，当携带天花、麻疹等病毒的欧洲探险者抵达，美洲人群毫无免疫力，死亡率极高；而欧洲人面对新大陆稀有且毒性低弱的本土病原，则几乎不受严重威胁。

Content: 美洲原住民（和土著岛民）对欧洲人没有很多疾病。瘟疫在人之间迅速传播。其次，如果您遭受瘟疫，则要么死亡或变得免疫。如果您生存，您将永远不会再得到它，因为现在您的身体知道如何杀死它。但是，您仍然可以携带瘟疫，并且可以将其传播给其他人，但不会伤害您。

Document ID: 2
Title: Why did Native Americans die from European diseases while Europeans didn't catch serious diseases from the New World? (history.stackexchange.com)
Content: Plagues prosper when you have a civilization/city which does a bad job of separating sewage from drinking water. This can help spread the plague, which helps evolve it fast. This makes deadly plagues. One such city which had bad water management was London.

Document ID: 3
Title: Why did Native Americans die from European diseases while Europeans didn't catch serious diseases from the New World? (history.stackexchange.com)
Content: So, since the New World had less cities (and less population), it had less plagues.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Why did Native Americans die from European diseases while Europeans didn't catch serious diseases from the New World? (history.stackexchange.com)
Content: This means that to have a plague, you must have as much contact with animals as possible. In the Old World, where farmers tended for cows and pigs, while warriors rode horses and elephants, there was a much higher chance of accidentally getting a disease from the animal that in the New World, where there was not as much contact between animals and humans.

Title: Off Grid Living: 12 Things You Must Know in 2021 (gokcecapital.com)
Content: Living off the land means you survive only by the resources that can be harvested from the land you own.


So, think food, water, and power.

Document ID: 3
Title: 5 Revealed Costs – Money It Takes to Live Off Grid (offgridliving.net)
Content: ### Home Insurance


Be aware that off grid homes tend to be farther from fire rescue and other emergency services and tend to have wood heat. This makes home insurance much more expensive than you might be used to. We have seen cases of people paying more than double what the usual rates are.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: 5 Revealed Costs – Money It Takes to Live Off Grid (offgridliving.net)
Content: ### Fire Wood


Many people going off grid anticipate cutting their own firewood, but underestimate the effort and cost of buying firewood. Depending on how cold your winters are, the quality of your stove, the type of wood you have access to, and the insulation of your house, you could end up using anywhere from about 3 to 10 cords of wood per season.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: 5 Revealed Costs – Money It Takes to Live Off Grid (offgridliving.net)
Content: A typical garden fence at homestead scale costs around $5,000. Most homesteaders go for a tall wire fence of this kind. Good quality fruit trees run about $60-$80/each. Berries – $15-$20/each. If you are buying seeds each year, then a large family garden would usually cost $100 – $200 per year.

question_src: 当我吃芦笋时，为什么我的小便闻起来像芦笋，但是当我吃凉爽的东西时，它永远不会像龙虾尾巴或冰淇淋圣代一样闻起来吗？
all_claims: 吃芦笋后尿液散发出特殊气味，是因为芦笋独有的山峰酸（asparagusic acid）在消化过程中被分解成多种含硫挥发物，这些硫化物气味刺鼻并在尿液排出时几乎立即蒸发[2]。
研究表明，气味可在进食后约15分钟出现，并可能持续长达14小时[3]。
相反，龙虾尾或冰淇淋等食物不含这种能迅速产生高挥发性硫化物的底物，因此它们的代谢产物不会显著改变尿味。
感知差异也起作用：有些人能更有效地分解硫副产物，使气味更浓[1]；另一些人因遗传变异缺乏检测这种气味的能力，一项针对6,909名成人的研究发现约58%男性与62%女性存在“芦笋尿失嗅症”[4]。
因此，芦笋特殊的化学成分及个体代谢与嗅觉差异，共同解释了只有它让你的尿闻起来“像芦笋”。
claims_retained: 吃芦笋后尿液散发出特殊气味，是因为芦笋独有的山峰酸（asparagusic acid）在消化过程中被分解成多种含硫挥发物，这些硫化物气味刺鼻并在尿液排出时几乎立即蒸发[2]。
研究表明，气味可在进食后约15分钟出现，并可能持续长达14小时[3]。

question_src: 公司为什么有“价值”？
all_claims: 公司设定核心价值观，首先是为了为日常决策提供明确的指南，使团队在复杂情形下能迅速判断何为正确选择 [1]。
这些价值观也成为绩效管理与评估的核心，使考核标准与公司信念保持一致 [5]。
对外而言，核心价值观向客户和潜在客户阐明公司存在的意义并刻画独特身份，从而建立信任与差异化 [2]。
对内而言，它们已成为关键的招聘与留才工具，帮助企业在竞争激烈的人才市场中脱颖而出 [3]。
当员工具有强烈的价值观认同时，他们留下来的可能性显著提高，而清晰而强大的价值体系还能吸引顶尖人才加入 [4]。
最终，通过明确核心价值观，公司不仅描述自己提供的产品或服务，还定义出共享的文化、使命和更大的存在理由，为长期发展奠定精神基石 [6]。

question_src: 公司为什么有“价值”？
all_claims: 公司设定核心价值观，首先是为了为日常决策提供明确的指南，使团队在复杂情形下能迅速判断何为正确选择 [1]。
这些价值观也成为绩效管理与评估的核心，使考核标准与公司信念保持一致 [5]。
对外而言，核心价值观向客户和潜在客户阐明公司存在的意义并刻画独特身份，从而建立信任与差异化 [2]。
对内而言，它们已成为关键的招聘与留才工具，帮助企业在竞争激烈的人才市场中脱颖而出 [3]。
当员工具有强烈的价值观认同时，他们留下来的可能性显著提高，而清晰而强大的价值体系还能吸引顶尖人才加入 [4]。
最终，通过明确核心价值观，公司不仅描述自己提供的产品或服务，还定义出共享的文化、使命和更大的存在理由，为长期发展奠定精神基石 [6]。

Content: Squatters rights refers to laws which allow a squatter to use or inhabit another person’s property in the event that the lawful owner does not evict or take action against the squatter.

question_src: 为什么要问一个人赚多少钱是一个人造pa？在其他文化中是这样吗？
all_claims: 在美国等英语文化中，询问别人收入被视为“人造pa”（社交禁忌），主要因为金钱被当作地位象征，公开比较会引发不愉快的竞争感[1]；人们担心收入曝光后会被他人评价高低[2]，收入高者怕遭嫉妒，低者怕被视为能力或道德失败[3]；因此“谈论你有多少钱”被认为违背社会惯例[4]。
然而这种禁忌并非普世；例如在巴拉圭，人们会自然地问你赚多少、电话费多少，甚至礼物花了多少钱，都被视为普通聊天[5]。
可见收入话题敏感度取决于文化对金钱与个人价值的关联强弱及社会不平等程度，美式避谈是一种特定社会结构和价值观塑造的“人造”禁忌，而非人类普遍本能。

question_src: 是什么导致我们割洋葱时撕裂？有没有办法防止这种情况？
all_claims: 切洋葱时，细胞被破坏后会释放酶和含硫化物，它们结合生成刺激性气体丙烯基硫氧化物（抗硫化 S-氧化物）；该气体接触眼睛泪膜后转化为微量硫酸，刺激角膜神经，使眼睛反射性大量分泌泪水以冲洗刺激物[1]。
因此产生的是“反射泪”，并非情绪所致[2]。
想减少流泪，可通过阻断或稀释气体：佩戴贴合的护目镜以阻止气体接触眼睛[3]；在一碗水中或自来水下切洋葱，让气体先溶于水[3]；切完后使用人工泪液滴眼，帮助润滑并冲洗残留刺激物[3]。
气体刺激只是短暂不适，对视力无长期危害，是否采取防护视个人需求而定[3]。

Title: 为什么洋葱会让你哭泣？酶，治疗等（www.healthline.com）
Content: 当洋葱破碎时，洋葱会喷出酶和硫酸。这些化合物结合起来产生抗硫化S-氧化物，一种刺激性的气体。


抗硫化S-氧化物是一种液化剂，这意味着当它接触眼睛时会产生眼泪。当抗硫化氧化物接触覆盖和保护眼球的水层时，它会变成硫酸。


但是就像洋葱一样，您的眼睛还配备了一种防御机制，旨在保护它们免受伤害。当每只眼睛的神经都检测到液化剂时，它们会产生眼泪以冲洗掉。

Title: Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Content: The tears you shed while chopping onions are not caused by any type of emotion. They’re reflex tears stimulated by exposure to irritants.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Chopping Onions Makes You Cry (www.webmd.com)
Content: "Your eyes have a set of nerves that detect anything that's potentially harmful to your eyes. Your eyes react to the gas that is formed, and your eyes try to flush it out with tears," Rosa explained in a school news release.


However, onions pose no serious threat to your visual health.


"Chopping onions can cause some burning and irritation and tears. Other than that, it's pretty safe on your eyes. It's a temporary sensation with no known long-term effects, nor will it worsen any other conditions, like pink eye," Rosa said.


Goggles can prevent the gas from reaching your eyes while cutting onions, but they aren't really necessary, he added.


"Some people may cut the onions in a bowl of water," Rosa said. "I'd personally recommend using eye drops, like comfort drops, to help lubricate or rinse the eyes and dilute the gas exposure to the eyes."

Title: Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Content: Onions spew enzymes and sulfenic acid when their skin is broken. These compounds combine to produce propanethial S-oxide, an irritating gas.


Propanethial S-oxide is a lachrymatory agent, meaning that it generates tears when it touches the eye. Propanethial S-oxide turns into sulfuric acid when it touches the water layer that covers and protects your eyeballs.


But just like onions, your eyes are also equipped with a defense mechanism meant to protect them from harm. When the nerves in each eye detect a lachrymatory agent, they generate tears to flush it out.

罗莎说：“切碎洋葱会引起一些燃烧，刺激和眼泪。除此之外，它在眼中还很安全。这是一种暂时的感觉，没有已知的长期影响，也不会恶化其他任何条件，例如粉红色的眼睛。”


他补充说，护目镜可以防止割洋葱时气体到达您的眼睛，但并不是真正必要的。


罗莎说：“有些人可能会在一碗水中切下洋葱。” “我个人建议使用眼滴（例如舒适滴）来帮助润滑或冲洗眼睛，并将气体暴露于眼睛。”

question_src: 高速公路流量如何建立？
all_claims: 高速公路流量的积聚往往始于小幅速度波动：当前车因并道或突发情况轻踩刹车，后车被迫连锁减速，形成“激波”，所有车辆随之放慢脚步，车速与间距骤降并迅速出现拥堵[1]。
当车流已接近设计容量（约80%–90%）时，此类扰动几分钟内即可把通行速度从100 km/h压至20 km/h。
若再加上白天施工导致车道被占用，通行能力下降，排队长度与延迟会显著加剧[2]。
可见，速度波动和有效车道减少是高速公路流量快速积聚的主要触发器，缓解方法包括将施工移至夜间、均衡车速与提供实时信息引导。
claims_retained: 若再加上白天施工导致车道被占用，通行能力下降，排队长度与延迟会显著加剧[2]。

claim: 在交流中，人们之所以努力保持眼神交流，是因为它能非语言地传递专注与尊重：当你注视对方时，对方会感受到你在积极倾听并把注意力放在他们身上
question_src: 人们为什么在交流时试图努力保持眼神交流？
all_claims: 在交流中，人们之所以努力保持眼神交流，是因为它能非语言地传递专注与尊重：当你注视对方时，对方会感受到你在积极倾听并把注意力放在他们身上[1]。
同时，恰当的目光接触还能向对方释放“我对你以及谈话内容感兴趣，并且充满自信”的信号，从而增强彼此的信任与互动效率[2]。
经验法则指出，讲话时约有50%的时间、倾听时约70%的时间保持对视，并且每次维持4-5秒后再轻轻移开，可避免盯视的压迫感并使沟通更自然[2]。
因此，眼神交流既是确认对话价值、增进情感联结的关键手段，也是展示个人自信和社交技巧的重要方式。

question_src: 当显然不是倍数时谈论一件衣服时，为什么要说“一条裤子/牛仔裤/短裤”？
all_claims: 我们之所以说“一条裤子/牛仔裤/短裤”而不用单数形式，源于早期的“裤子”实际上由两个独立的布片组成——人们先把其中一片套在一条腿上，再把另一片套在另一条腿上，最后在腰部系在一起，因此被视为“两件”[1]。
英语把这种只能以复数形式出现的名词称作 plurale tantum，即“仅复数名词”，裤子类词就归于此类[2]。
作为1840年首次记载的美国用法，“pants”原是“pantaloons”的缩写，而 pantaloons 一词源自意大利喜剧中同时穿着长袜和马裤的角色名称，这一历史渊源亦强化了其复数形式的沿用[3]。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: EarthSky | How many stars can you see? (earthsky.org)
Content: What if you were far away from city lights, on a night with no moon and no clouds or haze. How many stars could you see with your unaided eye?


There’s really no definitive answer to this question. No one has counted all the stars in the night sky, and astronomers use different numbers as theoretical estimates.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: EarthSky | How many stars can you see? (earthsky.org)
Content: Considering all the stars visible in all directions around Earth, the upper end on the estimates seems to be about 10,000 visible stars. Other estimates place the number of stars visible to the eye alone – surrounding the entire Earth – at more like 5,000. At any given time, half of Earth is in daylight. So only half the estimated number – say, between 5,000 and 2,500 stars – would be visible from Earth’s night side.


Plus, another fraction of those visible stars would be lost in the haze all around your horizon. That could bring you down to around 2,000, the number commonly used for these estimates. Just know that it varies depending on a number of factors.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Earthsky |您可以看到几颗星星？ （Earthsky.org）
Content: 您还必须考虑到夜空的亮度。即使在一个无月的夜晚，地球表面的灯光也使天空亮起。


尽管如此，远离城市灯光 - 在绝对完美的黑暗和天空清晰的条件下 - 一个有正常视力的年轻人与中年人应该能够看到成千上万的恒星。
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Globe at Night - What is Light Pollution? (www.globeatnight.org)
Content: Light pollution is excessive, misdirected, or obtrusive artificial (usually outdoor) light. Too much light pollution has consequences: it washes out starlight in the night sky, interferes with astronomical research, disrupts ecosystems, has adverse health effects and wastes energy.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: light pollution | Definition, Causes, & Facts | Britannica (www.britannica.com)
Content: Light pollution adversely affects professional and amateur astronomers, as well as casual observers of the night sky, because it severely reduces the visibility of stars and other celestial objects. The reduction in night sky visibility is a result of “skyglow,” upward-directed light emanating from poorly designed or directed lamps and security floodlights. This wasted light is scattered and reflected by solid or liquid particles in the atmosphere and then returned to the eyes of people on the ground, obliterating their view of the night sky.
---

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: While You Are Sleeping (www.webmd.com)
Content: It tends to go up and down a little during the day, and the same is true at night, although while you’re sleeping it can be 1 to 2 degrees lower than in the daytime. Body temperature starts to fall as bedtime approaches, paving the way for a good night’s sleep. Your body also tends to lose heat, which helps you fall and stay asleep. That’s one of the reasons experts say you shouldn’t exercise close to bedtime: Exercise heats you up. We sleep better when we’re cooler. Your temperature starts to rise toward morning, preparing your body for wakefulness.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Learn How to Sleep All Night Naturally and Not Wake Up (amerisleep.com)
Content: Keep it cool. The ideal temperature for sleep is around 65°, so set your thermostat accordingly. If that seems too chilly for comfort, experiment to find the temperature that’s right for you.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 太热了无法入睡吗？这里有很多冷却技巧（bebrainfit.com）
Content: 在睡眠周期的这一部分中，您将失去一些热量调节的能力，即将内部温度调节到周围的空气温度。


因此，当室温太热时，您的身体开始加热，这会唤醒您并难以入睡。
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Here Are The Effects Of Sleeping In A Cold Room | Sleep Advisor (www.sleepadvisor.org)
Content: A stressful day and an overactive brain aren’t the only things keeping you awake at night. Studies show that people who suffer from insomnia tend to have a warmer core body temperature before falling asleep than so-called normal people.


Remember that our bodies cool off at night in anticipation of sleep. But if your body automatically runs hot, you’ll have to alter your environment to cool your temperature down enough to signal that it’s time for bed.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Here Are The Effects Of Sleeping In A Cold Room | Sleep Advisor (www.sleepadvisor.org)
Content: Sleeping barefoot and sticking one or both feet out from under the covers will help keep you cooler. We lose a lot of body heat through our head, hands, and feet, so allowing your feet to breathe has a cooling effect.

question_src: 为什么sp@m ema1ls键入l1ke？
all_claims: 垃圾邮件发送者之所以把“free”写成“fr33”、把“email”写成“ema1l”，是因为垃圾邮件过滤器会扫描主题行和正文中的特定关键词，例如“免费”“金钱”等，一旦匹配就可能被直接拦截[1]；同时过滤器还会综合评估邮件内容来判断其是否为垃圾邮件[3]。
通过把字母替换为数字或符号，发送者可以在视觉上仍让收件人读懂单词，但机器检索时却难以命中完整的触发词，从而尝试绕过基于内容的检测规则。
不过，这种做法存在风险——过多使用 *、%、#、^ 等特殊字符本身也会触发过滤器，因此他们通常会在“足以欺骗算法”和“不过度触发规则”之间权衡[2]。

claim: 要判断一次地震是自然还是人类诱发，地震学家首先比较其时空分布与工业活动的关系：若震源集中在废水注入、采矿或水库区，并在作业启动或注液量变化后短期内出现，说明人为触发的可能性大；其次查看震源深度与聚簇特征，诱发地震通常较浅且在数月内成簇出现，而自然地震多沿深部断层长期活动；还会统计震级—频次关系并与历史背景比对，若某区原本地震稀少却在人类作业后迅速增加，同样指向人为因素
question_src: 地震学家：您如何确定地震是自然发生的还是是人类引起的？
all_claims: 要判断一次地震是自然还是人类诱发，地震学家首先比较其时空分布与工业活动的关系：若震源集中在废水注入、采矿或水库区，并在作业启动或注液量变化后短期内出现，说明人为触发的可能性大[2]；其次查看震源深度与聚簇特征，诱发地震通常较浅且在数月内成簇出现，而自然地震多沿深部断层长期活动[2]；还会统计震级—频次关系并与历史背景比对，若某区原本地震稀少却在人类作业后迅速增加，同样指向人为因素[2]。
然而，美国中部的最新观测表明，两类地震在应力释放和破坏潜力上几乎无差异，所以即便确认成因，仍应按自然地震的最严标准评估风险[1]。
claims_retained: 要判断一次地震是自然还是人类诱发，地震学家首先比较其时空分布与工业活动的关系：若震源集中在废水注入、采矿或水库区，并在作业启动或注液量变化后短期内出现，说明人为触发的可能性大[2]；其次查看震源深度与聚簇特征，诱发地震通常较浅且在数月内成簇出现，而自然地震多沿深部断层长期活动[2]；还会统计震级—频次关系并与历史背景比对，若某区原本地震稀少却在人类作业后迅速增加，同样指向人为因素[2]。

Title: Human-Induced and Natural Earthquakes are 'Inherently Similar,' According to LSA Researcher | U-M LSA U-M College of LSA (lsa.umich.edu)
Content: Huang's work discovered that stresses released by natural and human-caused earthquakes are similar, which means that the same tools might be used to predict both.


"Our study shows that induced earthquakes and natural earthquakes in the central U.S. are inherently similar, and we can predict the damaging effects of induced earthquakes using the same framework as natural earthquakes," said Huang.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 天然还是人造地震？新的斯坦福大学可以说出差异（news.stanford.edu）
Content: 斯坦福大学研究人员的一项新研究表明，人类活动触发的地震遵循了几种指示性模式，可以帮助科学家将其与自然发生的狂热区分开。
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Manmade and natural earthquakes not so different after all (earth.stanford.edu)
Content: The research concludes that human-induced and naturally occurring earthquakes in the central U.S. share the same shaking potential and can thus cause similar damage.


The finding contradicts previous observations suggesting that induced earthquakes exhibit weaker shaking than natural ones. The work could help scientists make predictions about future earthquakes and mitigate their potential damage.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 一起行走可能会解决大流行期间的冲突（www.psychologytoday.com）
Content: 社交步行是激活“镜像网络网络”的一种方法。


我们模仿彼此的步伐和步态，一致地挥舞着胳膊和腿。这会招募其他物理过程：我们的呼吸变得更加同步，心率在类似的时间增加和下降（随着我们行走更快或更慢，向上或向下）。一起行走还会引起社会认知处理，以帮助我们了解对方的意图和计划，并处理他们的社交线索（言语，表达，手势），以预测他们的运动并预测他们的轨迹。
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Mirror neuron system (www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov)
Content: Mirror neuron system is a group of specialized neurons that “mirrors” the actions and behaviour of others. The involvement of mirror neuron system (MNS) is implicated in neurocognitive functions (social cognition, language, empathy, theory of mind) and neuropsychiatric disorders.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: In sync and in control? (newsroom.ucla.edu)
Content: We have found that when men are walking in step with other men, they think that a potential foe is smaller and less physically formidable and less intimidating than when they’re just walking in no particularly coordinated manner with other men

Title: In sync and in control? (newsroom.ucla.edu)
Content: Even though each participant was accompanied only by a single companion, those who walked in unison with their partners judged the angry man as significantly less physically imposing than did the study subjects who had not walked in unison with their confederate: On average, they estimated that the man in the photo was about an inch shorter than the other participants did.

claim: 实验显示，某些鲨鱼（如柠檬鲨）能在几百米至约四分之一英里（≈0.4 km）的距离检测到极低浓度的血液，这说明它们对分子浓度的阈值比人类灵敏数百倍
question_src: 鲨鱼如何从公里处检测到血液。血液的某些分子必须“达到鲨鱼”吗？
all_claims: 鲨鱼的嗅觉器官位于鼻孔内的褶皱状感受细胞上，当它们游泳时，海水把化学分子——包括血液中的蛋白质及铁离子等气味分子——送入鼻管；只有当这些分子真正随海流漂移并抵达鲨鱼鼻孔时，神经信号才会被触发，所以“气味必须到达鲨鱼”这一说法是准确的[1]。
实验显示，某些鲨鱼（如柠檬鲨）能在几百米至约四分之一英里（≈0.4 km）的距离检测到极低浓度的血液，这说明它们对分子浓度的阈值比人类灵敏数百倍[1]。
此外，鲨鱼嗅觉是方向性的：若血液分子首先进入左鼻孔，鲨鱼能立即判断气味来自左侧，并沿着浓度梯度追踪来源[2]。
不过血味并非瞬时传到远处，而要随洋流扩散，因此距离越远、海况越静，分子抵达鲨鱼鼻孔所需时间就越长[1]。
claims_retained: 实验显示，某些鲨鱼（如柠檬鲨）能在几百米至约四分之一英里（≈0.4 km）的距离检测到极低浓度的血液，这说明它们对分子浓度的阈值比人类灵敏数百倍[1]。
此外，鲨鱼嗅觉是方向性的：若血液分子首先进入左鼻孔，鲨鱼能立即判断气味来自左侧，并沿着浓度梯度追踪来源[2]。

如果您在海洋中游泳时确实会流血，那么如果流氓鲨鱼决定攻击，有一段时间可以安全地进行岸边。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Can A Shark Really Smell A Drop Of Blood From A Mile Away? (www.ripleys.com)
Content: Even though there’s just a 1 in 3.7 million chance of being killed by a shark, people are so fearful of the predators that they’ve developed myths about them—such as their ability to smell a tiny drop of blood from miles away.


While sharks do have a strong sense of smell, this statement is largely overblown. Some sharks can identify blood a quarter-mile away, but the scent doesn’t reach them instantaneously or necessarily cause them to attack.


[Image: blue shark nostrils]


Sharks have a heightened sense of smell and olfactory system that is hundreds of times stronger than a human’s. Their nostrils, located beneath their snouts, are used only for smelling and not for breathing. They do have the capacity to detect tiny amounts of various compounds in the water. Some types of sharks, such as the lemon shark, can even detect a scent in a large swimming pool or a substance that is several hundred meters away.


But a shark more than a quarter-mile away won’t smell your blood and decide to make you into a yummy snack. Smells reach a shark through the currents, and it would take time for the scent to travel that distance to a shark’s nostrils. The motion of the ocean carries smell molecules with it, so, the more motion, the faster the smell will travel.


If you do start to bleed while swimming in the ocean, there is some time to get safely to shore in case a rogue shark decides to attack.

question_src: 防火墙如何工作？
all_claims: 防火墙部署在网络与设备之间，通过筛选进出数据包来决定阻断或放行，只让合法数据抵达终端[1]。
它依赖报文头部与规则比对：TCP头含源/目的地址、序列号等丰富字段，可进行精细过滤[1]。
UDP头信息较简单，通常只能按端口过滤[2]。
按处理深度，常见三类：无状态防火墙逐包检查，不分析上下文[3]；状态防火墙先收集多个数据包判定连接状态，再整体应用规则，提升准确性[4]；应用层防火墙更进一步解析载荷内容，发现应用级威胁[4]。
任何防火墙都非万能，其实效高度依赖正确配置与持续维护[1]。

Title: 防火墙如何工作？防火墙技术解释（Cyber​​security.att.com）
Content: 防火墙过滤网络流量，因此您仅收到应该获取的数据。没有防火墙完美效果，许多防火墙的有效性取决于您如何配置它。


为了基本了解防火墙的工作方式，了解TCP数据包的工作原理很重要。


您的计算机通过Internet发送和接收的数据由TCP数据包和UDP数据包组成。 TCP数据包可以通过防火墙更有效地过滤，因为它们的标题中包含更多信息。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Firewalls filter network traffic so that you only receive data that you should be getting. No firewall works perfectly, and a lot of a firewall's effectiveness depends on how you configure it.


To get a basic grasp of how firewalls work, it's important to understand how TCP packets work.


The data that your computer sends and receives over the internet or an internal network is comprised of TCP packets and UDP packets. TCP packets can be more effectively filtered by firewalls because they contain more information in their headers.


[Image]


TCP packets contain information such as source and destination addresses, packet sequence information, and payload. That information allows your network interface to deliver data properly, and a firewall can compare that information to the rules you configured it with. For example, all HTTPS data is transmitted through TCP packets. When HTTPS data is sent to your computer through your network interface while you surf the web, your operating system will know that it's data that's supposed to go to your web browser. The same applies if you are surfing the web - on your phone, on your PC, or even on a server machine in your datacenter. With the proliferation of the Internet of Things, you might even be surfing the web from a touchscreen embedded in your refrigerator. Your HTTPS data is used the same way regardless.
---

question_src: 为什么许多人喜欢在一定程度上与他人混在一起？
all_claims: 许多人倾向于在一定程度上与他人混在一起，首先是为了维系社交纽带并获得安全感：研究显示，感觉友谊和家庭关系不够稳固的人更可能迎合同伴的行为，以免被排斥[6]。
其次，群体行动是一种常见的压力应对机制；当个人缺乏冥想、运动等积极减压方式时，他们往往通过加入他人或模仿他人来暂时掩盖问题[1]。
为了掩饰对自己的真实感受，有些人把注意力投入到外界并与群体保持一致，这进一步巩固了“混在一起”的倾向[3]。
社会化过程中的性别和文化规范也起作用——66%的施暴者为男性，反映出男孩从小被要求“像男人一样”压抑情感，于是更依赖同伴认同来确认身份[2]。
最后，如果缺乏关于尊重与包容的教育，针对他人的仇恨对话会被视为常态，人在集体中就更可能盲目跟随错误的互动模式[5]。
因此，安全感的需求、压力调节、身份认同和教育水平共同塑造了人们喜欢与他人混在一起的社会行为。

Title: Why do People Bully? The Scientific Reasons - Ditch the Label (us.ditchthelabel.org)
Content: Our data shows that those who bully are far more likely than average to have experienced a stressful or traumatic situation in the past 5 years. Examples include their parents/guardians splitting up, the death of a relative or the gaining of a little brother or sister.


It makes sense because we all respond to stress in very different ways. Some of us use positive behaviours, such as meditation, exercise and talking therapy – all designed to relieve the stress.


Others use negative behaviours such as bullying, violence and alcohol abuse, which temporarily mask the issues but usually make them worse in the long-term.


The research shows that some people simply do not know how to positively respond to stress and so default to bullying others as a coping mechanism.

question_src: 如果人们可以构建自己的计算机，什么可以阻止人们构建自己的智能手机？
all_claims: 与台式机依赖标准化插槽与模块相比，智能手机的制约点在于零件高度集成且供应链分散：一部手机需要处理器主板、存储芯片、蜂窝/Wi-Fi/GPS等无线电芯片、触摸屏、电池、摄像头、加速度计等数十种专用元件，可能要与“超过100”家中国供应商分别洽购[2]；即便凑齐，仍要自行焊接 BGA 封装、调试射频、电源管理，并通过监管机构的射频与安全认证，这些环节远比组装电脑复杂。
业余玩家虽能用 Raspberry Pi + GSM 扩展板等模块搭成“可用但不时尚、不强大”的原型机[1]，或像手工项目一样少量购买组件自行拼装[3]，但其体积、功耗与性能难以与商业手机媲美。
简言之，阻碍来自元件获取难、集成度与制造门槛高、法规认证成本大，而非理论上的不可能。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Yes, you can build your own smartphone (www.zdnet.com)
Content: A number of people have asked me whether it possible to build a smartphone out of easily available parts. Absolutely. It won't be as sleek or as powerful as one you could pick up, and you will have to assemble it yourself, but it's one of those projects that's very doable.


Here's one example built around a Raspberry Pi board, and Adafruit Fona GSM board, a 5-megapixel camera, 802.11n Wi-Fi, and a 3.5-inch display. You'll have to shop around for some of these parts, but the last time I looked they were all still available.


Now, this might not be a device that you want to carry around with you as a daily smartphone, but it's something that you could integrate into a bigger project, such as an IoT hub or maybe a rugged handset for use in an off-road vehicle or boat.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 我想构建自己的智能手机（forums.tomsguide.com）
Content: 建造自己的智能手机可能几乎是不可能的。您需要主板和处理器不仅如此简单。您还需要担心更多的事情。存储芯片，加速度计，指南针，两个摄像机，无线电芯片（合并GPS，Wi-Fi，蓝牙和蜂窝），USB控制器芯片，Micro-USB端口，LCD面板，电容触摸，电池电池，电池，滑块，钥匙板，案例，案例等....大多数供应商来自中国。而且我认为您不住在中国。即使您居住在中国，您也可能必须联系中国的所有供应商（可能超过100），以获取智能手机的各个部分。
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Make Your Own Cellphone From Scratch. (www.instructables.com)
Content: n fact, you can make a cellphone in much the same way you'd make anything else: find the right parts, figure out how to connect them together, and try to do it in a way that's attractive and robust. Because of the ubiquity of cellphones, there are companies making the components they're made of; with some digging, I was able to find versions of these parts that are possible to buy in small quantities and that are possible to assemble by hand. This wasn't necessarily easy, but it's a very different problem than trying to learn the physics needed to understand how a cellphone tower works
---

claim: 库尔德人是伊朗语族的高地民族，其故土“库尔德斯坦”横跨土耳其东南、伊朗西北、伊拉克北部及叙利亚北部的山地
question_src: 谁是库尔德人？
all_claims: 库尔德人是伊朗语族的高地民族[1]，其故土“库尔德斯坦”横跨土耳其东南、伊朗西北、伊拉克北部及叙利亚北部的山地[1]。
总人口估计约3000万至4500万[1]，被视为全球最大的无国籍族群[4]，另有庞大侨民散居伊斯坦布尔和德国等地[1]。
多数库尔德人信奉逊尼派伊斯兰，但内部宗教多元，族群认同主要依共同语言与文化而非宗教[4]。
许多人自认为源自古代米底人，并在民族国歌中以此为傲[3]。
历史上，库尔德人活跃于伊朗、伊拉克、叙利亚和土耳其的政治军事舞台，16世纪奥斯曼帝国扩张后逐步失去自治领地[4]。

Content: 库尔德人（库尔德人：ک执者，库尔德）或库尔德人是伊朗人[28] [29] [30]族裔，该族裔是西亚山区的库尔德斯坦山区，横跨土耳其东南部，伊朗西北部，伊朗，伊朗，北部伊拉克和北部叙利亚。[31]。在安纳托利亚中部，霍拉桑和高加索地区有库尔德人的库尔德人，以及在土耳其西部（尤其是伊斯坦布尔）和西欧（主要在德国）的城市中的库尔德侨民社区。库尔德人口估计在30至4500万之间。[2] [32]

Document ID: 2
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The term gained the characteristic of an ethnonym following the Muslim conquest of Persia, as it was adopted into Arabic and gradually became associated with an amalgamation of Iranian and Iranicised tribes and groups in the region.[41][42]
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Many Kurds consider themselves descended from the Medes, an ancient Iranian people,[83] and even use a calendar dating from 612 BC, when the Assyrian capital of Nineveh was conquered by the Medes.[84] The claimed Median descent is reflected in the words of the Kurdish national anthem: "We are the children of the Medes and Kai Khosrow."

Document ID: 4
Title: Today, the Kurds are spread across four nations. Who are they? (www.nationalgeographic.com)
Content: If you can’t point to Kurdistan on a map, you’re not alone: It’s not a sovereign country. But for Kurds, an ethnic group of roughly 30 million people, it is very real indeed. Nestled on the margins of Turkey, Iran, Iraq, and Syria, Kurdistan is one of the planet’s most volatile regions, and its people are the world’s largest stateless group.


The Kurds are indigenous to the Middle East, but scholars and Kurdish people alike disagree as to the group’s origin. Nor do all Kurds share a religious identity: Though the majority of Kurds are Sunni Muslims, other religions are practiced as well.


What is clear is a Kurdish ethnic identity and common language. Those commonalities emerged around the Middle Ages. Since then, Kurds have played roles in the histories of what are now Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Turkey.


But while they flourished and wielded influence in the region, Kurds lost their lands when the Ottoman Empire took over most Kurdish-held territory in the 1500s.
---

question_src: 谁是库尔德人？
all_claims: 库尔德人是伊朗语族的高地民族[1]，其故土“库尔德斯坦”横跨土耳其东南、伊朗西北、伊拉克北部及叙利亚北部的山地[1]。
总人口估计约3000万至4500万[1]，被视为全球最大的无国籍族群[4]，另有庞大侨民散居伊斯坦布尔和德国等地[1]。
多数库尔德人信奉逊尼派伊斯兰，但内部宗教多元，族群认同主要依共同语言与文化而非宗教[4]。
许多人自认为源自古代米底人，并在民族国歌中以此为傲[3]。
历史上，库尔德人活跃于伊朗、伊拉克、叙利亚和土耳其的政治军事舞台，16世纪奥斯曼帝国扩张后逐步失去自治领地[4]。

claim: 神经被压迫后，向大脑发送信息的电化学信号暂时受阻，同时为神经供氧的血管也被挤压而减少供血
question_src: 当预见疼痛（例如橡皮筋折断皮肤）时，为什么我们会感到腿部刺痛的感觉？
all_claims: 当我们预见像橡皮筋抽打那样的疼痛时，出于“战或逃”反应，我们往往不自觉绷紧肌肉、屏住呼吸并保持僵硬姿势；这种姿势会把体重或肌肉张力集中在四肢，尤其是大腿和小腿，使这些部位的周围神经末端受到持续挤压[2]。
神经被压迫后，向大脑发送信息的电化学信号暂时受阻，同时为神经供氧的血管也被挤压而减少供血[3]。
当紧张感稍缓或姿势改变，压力随之解除，血流和信号传导迅速恢复，但因“断—续”式传输而产生短暂放电，便在腿部出现典型的刺痛、发麻或“皮肤爬行”感觉[1]。
因此，这种预期疼痛引发的下肢刺痛，本质上是紧张导致的姿势性神经压迫造成的暂时性感觉异常，而非真正由腿部受伤引起。
claims_retained: 神经被压迫后，向大脑发送信息的电化学信号暂时受阻，同时为神经供氧的血管也被挤压而减少供血[3]。

Title: Paresthesia: Causes of Pins and Needles, Numbness, and "Skin Crawling" (www.webmd.com)
Content: Paresthesia happens because of pressure on a nerve. When that pressure is gone -- you uncross your legs, for example -- the feeling goes away.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Causes of Tingling Sensations in the Body - You are Mom (youaremom.com)
Content: Temporary paresthesia, also known as tingling, is a fairly uncomfortable sensation that can be experienced in any part of the body. However, it usually occurs in our extremities, which is to say our arms, hands, legs, and feet.


When this happens, it’s understood that the central and peripheral nervous systems are involved. To put it in simple terms, this occurs when some kind of pressure is exerted on the nerve terminals, generally in the extremities.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 体内刺痛的原因 - 您是妈妈（youaremom.com）
Content: 现在，您可能想知道为什么这种感觉主要发生在手臂和腿上。原因是我们很常见地通过坐着，倾斜或持有一定的位置来对这些区域施加压力。


发生这种情况时，我们对所讨论区域的神经施加压力，这些神经负责在身体和大脑之间传输信息。


此外，姿势所涉及的压力切断了将氧气带入神经的血管。因此，这些无法将信息发送给大脑。


[图像：体内刺痛感的原因]


当压力得到缓解时，刺痛开始，神经恢复传输信号，尽管延迟的方式。

claim: 唾液结石（又称唾液腺结石）是在唾液腺或其导管内形成的钙化矿物硬块，可阻塞唾液排出
question_src: 解释：在您的唾液腺中有“石头”。
all_claims: 唾液结石（又称唾液腺结石）是在唾液腺或其导管内形成的钙化矿物硬块，可阻塞唾液排出[3]。
该病多累及口底的下颌下腺，也可影响腮腺或舌下腺，且不少患者可同时存在多枚结石[3]。
30–60岁人群最易发生，男性多于女性[1]。
虽然确切原因未明，但脱水、口腔创伤、吸烟及牙龈疾病被认为与其发生相关[2]；此外，不良饮食和使用某些抗组胺药、血压药、精神药及膀胱控制药等可因使唾液减少或增稠而增加风险[4]。
当结石较小或症状轻微时，可通过家庭疗法自我处理：吮吸柠檬等柑橘或硬糖以刺激分泌、充足饮水、轻柔按摩受累腺体、服用布洛芬或对乙酰氨基酚止痛，并含冰块减轻肿胀[5]。
若出现持续疼痛、明显腺体肿大或反复感染，应及时就医，由口腔颌面外科或耳鼻喉科医生评估并考虑取石等干预。
claims_retained: 唾液结石（又称唾液腺结石）是在唾液腺或其导管内形成的钙化矿物硬块，可阻塞唾液排出[3]。
该病多累及口底的下颌下腺，也可影响腮腺或舌下腺，且不少患者可同时存在多枚结石[3]。
30–60岁人群最易发生，男性多于女性[1]。
虽然确切原因未明，但脱水、口腔创伤、吸烟及牙龈疾病被认为与其发生相关[2]；此外，不良饮食和使用某些抗组胺药、血压药、精神药及膀胱控制药等可因使唾液减少或增稠而增加风险[4]。

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: Salivary stones, also called sialolithiasis, are hardened mineral deposits that form in the salivary glands. The condition is more likely to affect people age 30 to 60 and men are more likely to get salivary stones than women.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: The cause is not known, but several factors are associated with salivary stone formation:


* Dehydration, due to inadequate fluid intake, illness, or medications such as diuretics (water pills) and anticholinergic drugs


* Trauma to the inside of the mouth


* Smoking


* Gum disease
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 唾液腺结石：症状，原因和治疗（www.webmd.com）
Content: 唾液腺石 - 也称为唾液管结石 - 是一种钙化结构，可能在唾液腺或管道内形成。它可以阻止唾液流入嘴。


大多数石头会影响位于嘴地板的下颌腺。不太常见的是，石头会影响腮腺，位于脸颊内部或舌下的舌下腺体，这些腺体在舌头下。许多患有这种情况的人有多个石头。
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Content: Salivary stones form when chemicals in the saliva accumulate in the duct or gland. They mostly contain calcium. The exact cause is not known. But factors contributing to less saliva production and/or thickened saliva may be risk factors for salivary stones. These factors include: dehydration, poor eating, and use of certain medications including some antihistamines, blood pressure drugs, psychiatric drugs, and bladder control drugs. Trauma to the salivary glands may also raise the risk for salivary stones.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Salivary stones: Symptoms, causes, and how to get rid of them (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Salivary stones are rarely serious, and a person can often treat them at home.


Home remedies for getting rid of salivary stones include:


* Sucking on citrus fruits or hard candies. Sucking on a wedge of lemon or orange increases the flow of saliva, which can help dislodge the stone. A person can also try sucking on sugar-free gum or hard, sour candies, such as lemon drops.
* Drinking plenty of fluids. Regular fluid intake helps keep the mouth hydrated and can increase saliva flow.
* Gentle massage. Gently massaging the affected area may relieve pain and encourage the stone to pass through the salivary duct. The Sjogren’s Syndrome Foundation have an illustrated guide on how to do this on their website.
* Medications. Some over-the-counter drugs, such as ibuprofen and acetaminophen, can help relieve pain and swelling.
* Sucking on ice cubes. Sucking on something cold, such as an ice cube or ice pop, may also help reduce pain and swelling resulting from salivary stones.
---

当结石较小或症状轻微时，可通过家庭疗法自我处理：吮吸柠檬等柑橘或硬糖以刺激分泌、充足饮水、轻柔按摩受累腺体、服用布洛芬或对乙酰氨基酚止痛，并含冰块减轻肿胀[5]。
若出现持续疼痛、明显腺体肿大或反复感染，应及时就医，由口腔颌面外科或耳鼻喉科医生评估并考虑取石等干预。

该病多累及口底的下颌下腺，也可影响腮腺或舌下腺，且不少患者可同时存在多枚结石[3]。

Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: Salivary stones, also called sialolithiasis, are hardened mineral deposits that form in the salivary glands. The condition is more likely to affect people age 30 to 60 and men are more likely to get salivary stones than women.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Content: The cause is not known, but several factors are associated with salivary stone formation:


* Dehydration, due to inadequate fluid intake, illness, or medications such as diuretics (water pills) and anticholinergic drugs


* Trauma to the inside of the mouth


* Smoking


* Gum disease
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 唾液腺结石：症状，原因和治疗（www.webmd.com）
Content: 唾液腺石 - 也称为唾液管结石 - 是一种钙化结构，可能在唾液腺或管道内形成。它可以阻止唾液流入嘴。


大多数石头会影响位于嘴地板的下颌腺。不太常见的是，石头会影响腮腺，位于脸颊内部或舌下的舌下腺体，这些腺体在舌头下。许多患有这种情况的人有多个石头。
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Content: Salivary stones form when chemicals in the saliva accumulate in the duct or gland. They mostly contain calcium. The exact cause is not known. But factors contributing to less saliva production and/or thickened saliva may be risk factors for salivary stones. These factors include: dehydration, poor eating, and use of certain medications including some antihistamines, blood pressure drugs, psychiatric drugs, and bladder control drugs. Trauma to the salivary glands may also raise the risk for salivary stones.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Salivary stones: Symptoms, causes, and how to get rid of them (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Salivary stones are rarely serious, and a person can often treat them at home.


Home remedies for getting rid of salivary stones include:


* Sucking on citrus fruits or hard candies. Sucking on a wedge of lemon or orange increases the flow of saliva, which can help dislodge the stone. A person can also try sucking on sugar-free gum or hard, sour candies, such as lemon drops.
* Drinking plenty of fluids. Regular fluid intake helps keep the mouth hydrated and can increase saliva flow.
* Gentle massage. Gently massaging the affected area may relieve pain and encourage the stone to pass through the salivary duct. The Sjogren’s Syndrome Foundation have an illustrated guide on how to do this on their website.
* Medications. Some over-the-counter drugs, such as ibuprofen and acetaminophen, can help relieve pain and swelling.
* Sucking on ice cubes. Sucking on something cold, such as an ice cube or ice pop, may also help reduce pain and swelling resulting from salivary stones.
---

question_src: 在听到植入物之类的事情之后，第一次听到的人知道其他人在说什么吗？
all_claims: 通常，首次启用人工耳蜗时，人们只能听到陌生、电子化的声音，却难以立即辨认或理解语言内容，因为大脑尚未学会如何把植入物传来的电信号转换成有意义的语音[2]。
大多数使用者随后需要进行为期一年到 12 年不等的语音训练，以逐步开辟新的神经通路并学习“如何倾听”[1]。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What’s It Like for a Deaf Person to Hear for the First Time? (slate.com)
Content: Most children will require at least some speech therapy, depending what age they received their implants. Training time ranges from a year to 12 (I clocked in at 11) and varies in terms of intensity. As they learn how to listen, their brains are doing heavy lifting by burning new neural pathways. Some of them will never listen or speak like someone born hearing due to various factors out of people’s control.


Hearing—or, rather, the perception of it—isn’t a light switch you flip on and off. It’s serious business.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 人工耳蜗植入物-Mayo诊所（www.mayoclinic.org）
Content: 人工耳蜗使用适合耳朵后面的声音处理器。处理器捕获声音信号，并将其发送到耳朵后面皮肤下植入的接收器。接收器将信号发送到植入蜗牛形内耳（耳蜗）的电极。


信号刺激听觉神经，然后将它们引导到大脑。大脑将这些信号解释为声音，尽管这些声音不会像正常的听力一样。


学习解释从人工耳蜗收到的信号需要时间和培训。在使用的一年内，大多数有人工耳蜗的人在理解语音方面带来了可观的收益。
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Cochlear Implant: Cost, Pros, Cons, Risks, How It Works (www.healthline.com)
Content: Though the brain will notice the sounds, they’re not the same as normal hearing. Speech therapy and rehabilitation are necessary to learn how to properly interpret these sounds.

Title: 第一次听到聋人的声音是什么感觉？ （slate.com）
Content: 大多数孩子至少需要一些语音疗法，具体取决于他们收到的植入物的年龄。训练时间范围从一年到12岁（我以11个为单位），而强度有所不同。当他们学习如何倾听时，他们的大脑正在通过燃烧新的神经通路来进行繁重的举动。由于人们无法控制的各种因素，他们中的一些人永远不会像天生的听证会那样听或说话。


听力 - 或者是对它的感知 - 不是您可以打开和关闭的轻型开关。这是认真的生意。

Document ID: 2
Title: Cochlear implants - Mayo Clinic (www.mayoclinic.org)
Content: Cochlear implants use a sound processor that fits behind the ear. The processor captures sound signals and sends them to a receiver implanted under the skin behind the ear. The receiver sends the signals to electrodes implanted in the snail-shaped inner ear (cochlea).


The signals stimulate the auditory nerve, which then directs them to the brain. The brain interprets those signals as sounds, though these sounds won't be just like normal hearing.


It takes time and training to learn to interpret the signals received from a cochlear implant. Within a year of use, most people with cochlear implants make considerable gains in understanding speech.
---

Content: Though the brain will notice the sounds, they’re not the same as normal hearing. Speech therapy and rehabilitation are necessary to learn how to properly interpret these sounds.

claim: 在20世纪早期的广播与好莱坞电影中，演员与播音员普遍使用一种被称为“跨大西洋”或“中大西洋”口音的发音体系，它同时也被戏剧界称为“美国舞台标准”
question_src: 为什么所有古老的配音录音中的人们都有相同的“旧时代”口音？
all_claims: 在20世纪早期的广播与好莱坞电影中，演员与播音员普遍使用一种被称为“跨大西洋”或“中大西洋”口音的发音体系，它同时也被戏剧界称为“美国舞台标准”[1]。
这种口音并非自然形成，而是通过专门训练刻意融合英式与美式英语，削弱地方特色，使说话人在大西洋两岸都易于被理解，并营造上流、受教育的形象[2]。
另一方面，早期麦克风和扬声器缺乏低频还原能力，为了让观众透过嘈杂收音机或影院喇叭清晰听见对话，播音员和演员必须使用更高、带鼻音、节奏分明的发声方法，这种技术需求进一步统一了“旧时代”录音的听感[3]。
二战后该口音的教学迅速式微，音频设备改善也不再需要这种发声方式，于是它几乎绝迹，只在老配音或黑白影片中留下独特回声[4]。

Content: This consciously learned accent was a blend of American English and British English which favoured neither. Its premise was to neutralise strong accents and eliminate Britishisms and Americanisms so that the speaker could be understood on both sides of the Atlantic Ocean. Hence its name.

claim: 熔岩虽炽热，但成千上万种塑料、橡胶和织物会漂浮在粘稠的熔岩上而非沉入其中，因而无法被彻底分解
question_src: 为什么我们不能只将所有垃圾倒入熔岩熔岩中以消除它，而不是在垃圾填埋场中渗出并污染地下水呢？
all_claims: 熔岩虽炽热，但成千上万种塑料、橡胶和织物会漂浮在粘稠的熔岩上而非沉入其中，因而无法被彻底分解[1]。
熔岩湖体积有限，熔化后的废物最终仍会堆积或以烟雾形式逸散，释放难以呼吸的有毒气体并进入大气[1]。
当相对冷却的垃圾刺入熔岩湖，剧烈热冲击会释放高压酸性蒸汽，引发爆炸链反应；夏威夷火山就曾将熔岩抛射至85米高，说明其危险性[2]。
这种爆炸不但威胁运输和投放人员，也危及周边社区[2]。
理论上较“温和”的盾状火山全球仅约600座且多已休眠，而潜在活火山总数只有1500座，覆盖面远不足以服务所有国家[3]。
为把垃圾送到这些有限地点，需要无休止的卡车长途运输，费用高昂且伴随额外碳排放[3]。
综合熔解效率、毒烟、爆炸风险、火山稀缺与运输成本等因素，将垃圾倒入熔岩既不现实，也并不比现代填埋或回收更清洁。

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 为什么我们不能将所有垃圾倒入火山？ （www.scienceabc.com）
Content: 熔岩湖无可否认是自然的复杂和不可预测的奇观。他们非常热，它们可以融化很多东西，但不是一切。有成千上万种形式的塑料，橡胶，织物和其他材料会漂浮在粘性熔岩上，而不是沉入加热的空隙中。


[图片：lava_lake_nyiragongo]


一个活跃的熔岩湖（照片来源：Cai Tjeenk Willink /Wikimedia Commons）


其次，熔岩湖不是无限深。所有融化的垃圾都必须最终到达某个地方，尽管其中大部分可能会消失在烟雾和蒸气中，但这种破坏产生的烟雾会非常有害，可以呼吸或散发到大气中。


实际上，由于熔岩湖确实有有限的体积，而且由于内部构成了令人难以置信的压力，而且通常会在发泄中移动，而且通常会在发泄中移动，但熔岩湖确实有限。
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Lava lakes are unstable beneath their semi-solid, comparatively cool upper layer. If you pierce their surfaces with a relatively cold object, like a piece of trash, the sudden transfer of heat could trigger a chain reaction of explosions. The upper layer starts melting down, releasing pressurized acidic steam and fumes from the vaporized trash. A single tin can might serve as a trigger to start this chain reaction and invoke the wrath of the previously stagnant lava lake!


[Image: Related image]


A chain reaction in action ( https://africageographic.com/blog/hot-as-hell-at-erta-ale/)


Now, imagine the impact of throwing an entire nation’s garbage in a volcano… unimaginably destructive chain reactions would begin. To put this in perspective, minute rockfalls into lava lakes of Hawaiian volcanoes have forced lava more than 85 m (280 feet) into the air. The scenario with tons of garbage would be far more treacherous and perilous for anyone working on the garbage-disposal task.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Garbage into volcanoes: How safe is it to dump rubbish into volcanoes? (www.scientificmystery.com)
Content: There are three types of volcanoes – strato, shield, and dome. Out of these, an ideal volcano to dump the trash would be a shield volcano. It is low profile lava, i.e. it has a slow eruption, with lave slowly spewing out onto the earth. However, the numbers of them are not very common. There are only 600 shield volcanoes, with most of them being inactive. There is the number of stratovolcanoes scattered on the earth, but they are known for their explosive nature. Thus, they are definitely not the spot for the dump.


[Image]


Credit-Tropical-Helicopters


Above all, disposing the trash into the lava would be a very expensive method. We have to have the endless stream of trucks traveling to the nearest active volcano to dispose of the trash. An even bigger problem is that there are not as many active volcanoes in the world; there are only 1500 potentially active volcanoes worldwide. When most of the countries don’t have any active volcano, the problem for those countries would still persist.
---

Title: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Lava lakes are unstable beneath their semi-solid, comparatively cool upper layer. If you pierce their surfaces with a relatively cold object, like a piece of trash, the sudden transfer of heat could trigger a chain reaction of explosions. The upper layer starts melting down, releasing pressurized acidic steam and fumes from the vaporized trash. A single tin can might serve as a trigger to start this chain reaction and invoke the wrath of the previously stagnant lava lake!


[Image: Related image]


A chain reaction in action ( https://africageographic.com/blog/hot-as-hell-at-erta-ale/)


Now, imagine the impact of throwing an entire nation’s garbage in a volcano… unimaginably destructive chain reactions would begin. To put this in perspective, minute rockfalls into lava lakes of Hawaiian volcanoes have forced lava more than 85 m (280 feet) into the air. The scenario with tons of garbage would be far more treacherous and perilous for anyone working on the garbage-disposal task.

claims_retained: 熔岩虽炽热，但成千上万种塑料、橡胶和织物会漂浮在粘稠的熔岩上而非沉入其中，因而无法被彻底分解[1]。
熔岩湖体积有限，熔化后的废物最终仍会堆积或以烟雾形式逸散，释放难以呼吸的有毒气体并进入大气[1]。
当相对冷却的垃圾刺入熔岩湖，剧烈热冲击会释放高压酸性蒸汽，引发爆炸链反应；夏威夷火山就曾将熔岩抛射至85米高，说明其危险性[2]。
这种爆炸不但威胁运输和投放人员，也危及周边社区[2]。
理论上较“温和”的盾状火山全球仅约600座且多已休眠，而潜在活火山总数只有1500座，覆盖面远不足以服务所有国家[3]。
为把垃圾送到这些有限地点，需要无休止的卡车长途运输，费用高昂且伴随额外碳排放[3]。

Title: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Lava lakes are undeniably complex and unpredictable wonders of nature. Being extremely hot, they can melt plenty of things, but not everything. There are thousands of forms of plastic, rubber, fabrics and other such materials that would float atop the viscous lava, rather than sinking into the heated void.


[Image: Lava_Lake_Nyiragongo]


An active Lava Lake (Photo Credit: Cai Tjeenk Willink /Wikimedia Commons)


Secondly, lava lakes are not infinitely deep. All that melted trash would have to end up somewhere, and while most of it might vanish in plumes of smoke and vapour – the smoke emanating from that destruction would be incredibly harmful to breathe or send up into the atmosphere.


As terrifying and wrathful as lava lakes are, in reality, they do have a finite volume, and are often on the move up and out of the vent, due to the incredible pressures building up inside.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Lava lakes are unstable beneath their semi-solid, comparatively cool upper layer. If you pierce their surfaces with a relatively cold object, like a piece of trash, the sudden transfer of heat could trigger a chain reaction of explosions. The upper layer starts melting down, releasing pressurized acidic steam and fumes from the vaporized trash. A single tin can might serve as a trigger to start this chain reaction and invoke the wrath of the previously stagnant lava lake!


[Image: Related image]


A chain reaction in action ( https://africageographic.com/blog/hot-as-hell-at-erta-ale/)


Now, imagine the impact of throwing an entire nation’s garbage in a volcano… unimaginably destructive chain reactions would begin. To put this in perspective, minute rockfalls into lava lakes of Hawaiian volcanoes have forced lava more than 85 m (280 feet) into the air. The scenario with tons of garbage would be far more treacherous and perilous for anyone working on the garbage-disposal task.

[图像]


信用 - 热带螺旋体

all_claims: 当计算机崩溃时，核心进程突然停止或进入无法恢复的死循环，操作系统无法继续协调硬件与软件，因而表现为蓝屏、冻结或自动重启。
最常见的根源是操作系统代码中的缺陷或硬件故障；前者比例更高，但后者往往更具毁灭性且难以定位[1]。
在 Windows 电脑中，若注册表文件损坏，系统无法读取关键配置，也会立即导致崩溃[2]；注册表包含多个对性能与操作至关重要的文件，任何损坏都会使系统失去指令“路线图”[3]。
随着使用时间增长，文件被分割存放于磁盘空隙中，过度碎片化会让系统在读取时频频超时而崩溃[4]。
恶意软件通过篡改系统文件或耗尽资源，同样可能触发崩溃[5]。
当物理内存被占满，操作系统找不到可用空间保存正在运行的数据，也会被迫终止[6]。
如果散热风扇老化导致 CPU 过热，硬件保护机制会切断电源或降低频率，系统因此宕机[7]。

question_src: 当我的计算机崩溃时到底发生了什么？
all_claims: 当计算机崩溃时，核心进程突然停止或进入无法恢复的死循环，操作系统无法继续协调硬件与软件，因而表现为蓝屏、冻结或自动重启。
最常见的根源是操作系统代码中的缺陷或硬件故障；前者比例更高，但后者往往更具毁灭性且难以定位[1]。
在 Windows 电脑中，若注册表文件损坏，系统无法读取关键配置，也会立即导致崩溃[2]；注册表包含多个对性能与操作至关重要的文件，任何损坏都会使系统失去指令“路线图”[3]。
随着使用时间增长，文件被分割存放于磁盘空隙中，过度碎片化会让系统在读取时频频超时而崩溃[4]。
恶意软件通过篡改系统文件或耗尽资源，同样可能触发崩溃[5]。
当物理内存被占满，操作系统找不到可用空间保存正在运行的数据，也会被迫终止[6]。
如果散热风扇老化导致 CPU 过热，硬件保护机制会切断电源或降低频率，系统因此宕机[7]。

question_src: 摄影师特里·理查森（Terry Richardson）为什么如此著名和普遍。
all_claims: 美国时尚摄影师特里·理查森之所以备受关注，首先在于他“当今最多产、著名的摄影师之一”的行业地位 [2]；其次，他以标志性的快照美学和充满性张力的表现手法，为主流广告注入大胆、叛逆的视觉冲击，迅速引发大众与品牌的兴趣 [2]。
其作品长期围绕名人、性观念、裸露和幽默等重复主题，话题性强且易于传播 [1]。
他从最初的白色背景发展到高饱和色彩、宝丽来质感、夸张表情与闷热姿势，形成与其他摄影截然不同的时髦氛围 [3]。
理查森还常在照片中与明星同框，甚至把自己的眼镜借给对方，制造即兴亲密感，令被摄者像在与朋友玩乐般放松 [1]。
从奥巴马、林赛·洛汉到瑞安娜等顶级名人相继入镜，使其作品在媒体与社交平台上获得极高曝光度 [3]。

claim: 空气过滤器负责为发动机提供充足且洁净的空气；一旦滤芯被尘土与碎屑堵塞，进气受限，发动机需“憋气”运转、负荷增加，因而喷入更多汽油，燃油经济性随之下降
question_src: 车辆的空气过滤器如何影响其气体行驶里程？
all_claims: 空气过滤器负责为发动机提供充足且洁净的空气；一旦滤芯被尘土与碎屑堵塞，进气受限，发动机需“憋气”运转、负荷增加，因而喷入更多汽油，燃油经济性随之下降[1]。
Firestone资料同样指出，受阻进气会迫使发动机更费力工作，带来较差的油耗并可能损失动力[3]。
相反，按时更换脏滤清器可恢复顺畅气流：研究表明，在旧式化油器车辆上，汽油行驶里程可提升约10%，折合每加仑节省最高0.15美元；对现代电喷车，则可使加速性能提升6%–11%，间接体现油耗改善[2]。
因此，保持空气滤清器清洁是一项成本低、见效快的节油措施——滤芯越干净，发动机越轻松，车辆跑同样距离所需汽油就越少。

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 更换空气过滤器可以改善汽油里程吗？ - （www.pgfilters.com）
Content: 肮脏的空气过滤器减少了气流 - 空气过滤器中的材料和合成纤维制成的媒介中的陷阱污染物。随着时间的流逝，这种媒体充满了污垢和碎屑，以防止发动机呼吸正确。结果，发动机将更加努力地使用并使用更多的燃料。
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 5 Benefits of Changing Your Air Filter (www.carsdirect.com)
Content: One of the biggest reasons to change your air filter regularly. Some studies indicate that replacing a dirty air filter increases fuel mileage on older, carburated cars by as much as 14 percent if the filter is so dirty it affects driveability. In addition, changing a clogged air filter can potentially increase acceleration by 6 to 11 percent on modern fuel-injected cars. Other studies claim a 10 percent increase in gas mileage and up to 15¢ per gallon fuel savings. Regardless of the exact figures, it is obvious that a clean air filter improves air flow to the engine and increases engine performance and gas mileage.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: FAQs About Your Car's Fuel and Air Filters (www.firestonecompleteautocare.com)
Content: When your air filter is dirty, your engine is forced to work harder, resulting in poor fuel economy, higher emissions and, possibly, a loss of engine power. In turn, as a worst-case scenario, a clogged cabin air filter can lead to under-performance of the A/C system, causing weak air flow from the cabin vents. It can also lead to unwanted, unfiltered air in the cabin. question_src: 为什么吸烟会引起癌症，而吸烟大麻不会？
all_claims: 吸烟之所以被明确认定能致癌，是因为香烟烟雾中已检测到至少70种致癌化学物，这些化学物随吸入进入血液并损伤控制细胞生长的DNA，从而启动癌变过程[2]；数十年的大规模流行病学研究亦证实了这种因果关系。
大麻烟雾其实也含有与烟草烟“许多相同的引起癌症的物质”[1]，理论上具备类似危害，但目前尚未确立“吸烟大麻一定致癌”的结论，原因主要是：①使用者通常吸食频率和终生总量低于每日多支的香烟，使累积暴露剂量较小；②很多大麻使用者同时抽烟，难以分离大麻与香烟的独立效应[1]；③现有研究样本有限且随访时间较短，尚不足以观察到潜在的癌症发生差异[1]。
因此，“香烟致癌”是证据确凿，“大麻不致癌”只是尚缺确定性证据，并非大麻烟无害。

Title: UTIs and urinating after sexual intercourse: What is the link? (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Experts debate whether urinating after sex helps prevent UTIs.


Many health authorities, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), recommend urinating after sex to prevent UTIs. Doing so may help flush away bacteria that are close to the urethra and prevent them from entering the urinary tract.


However, research published in a 2016 edition of American Family Physician suggests that urinating after sex does not have any measurable protective effects. Still, the researchers note, it is a safe and reasonable thing to do.

question_src: 当我观看烹饪表演时，它永远不会显示厨师洗手或清洁任何东西，厨师多久洗一次手？那刀，餐具等呢？
all_claims: 节目中看不到洗手画面，是因为电视厨师通常在拍摄前和拍摄结束后就已洗手，这些“无聊”片段为压缩时长常被剪掉，所以观众误以为他们从不清洁双手 [1]。
然而一项对电视烹饪节目的实证分析显示，除三位厨师外，其余人至少有一次没有洗手就继续操作食材，只有Emeril Lagasse在镜头里提醒观众要先洗手 [2]。
同一研究还指出，19 位厨师赤手触碰已完全烹熟的食物，仅约三分之一的人在处理生肉后更换或清洁砧板，说明刀具和餐具的交叉污染控制也经常被忽略 [2]。
综上，节目里的真实做法与编辑后的呈现并不一致；按食品安全规范，厨师应在处理生食、接触身体、打喷嚏或换食材等每个关键节点立即洗手，并及时用热水和洗涤剂清洗或更换刀具、砧板和餐具，以避免病菌传播。

同一研究还指出，19 位厨师赤手触碰已完全烹熟的食物，仅约三分之一的人在处理生肉后更换或清洁砧板，说明刀具和餐具的交叉污染控制也经常被忽略 [2]。
综上，节目里的真实做法与编辑后的呈现并不一致；按食品安全规范，厨师应在处理生食、接触身体、打喷嚏或换食材等每个关键节点立即洗手，并及时用热水和洗涤剂清洗或更换刀具、砧板和餐具，以避免病菌传播。

claim: 人体关节、骨骼和肌肉组合成的杠杆系统中，大多数是三等杆
question_src: 为什么我们体内有这么多三等杆？
all_claims: 人体关节、骨骼和肌肉组合成的杠杆系统中，大多数是三等杆[2]。
虽然这种类型在力臂上处于机械劣势，肌肉必须施加大于负荷的力量[1]，但它具有关键优点：肌肉在靠近关节的短距离收缩即可在远端产生更大的角位移和角速度，从而让手、足等末端结构移动得更远、更快[4]。
人类运动的目标通常不是搬运极重物体，而是完成奔跑、投掷、抓握等需要速度和幅度的精细动作，因此牺牲力的效率来换取运动范围和速度更符合功能需求[4]。
因此，进化选择了大量三等杆布局，以用较小的肌肉收缩距离实现大幅、快速而精确的末端运动，这就是我们体内三等杆占绝对多数的原因[2]。

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Third-Class Levers in the Human Body | Science project | Education.com (www.education.com)
Content: In a third-class lever, the input force is in between the output force and the fulcrum. An example of this class of lever is a baseball bat. The handle of the bat is the fulcrum, you supply the input force near the middle, and the other end of the bat that pushes the ball with the output forces. In a third-class lever, the input force is greater than the output force but the output load is able to move farther.

[Image: Examples of Levers]

You have several third-class levers in your body. One that is easy to investigate is your forearm.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: 杠杆努力创造人体运动（us.humankinetics.com）
Content: 骨骼，韧带和肌肉是形成体内杠杆以创造人类运动的结构。简而言之，一个接头（两个或多个骨头一起融合在一起）形成轴（或支点），而越过关节的肌肉则施加力移动重量或电阻。杠杆通常将其标记为头等舱，二等或三类。所有三种类型都在体内发现，但是人体中的大多数杠杆都是三等阶层。
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Content: There are numerous third-class levers in the human body; one example can be illustrated in the elbow joint (figure 1.23b). The joint is the axis (fulcrum). The resistance (weight) is the forearm, wrist, and hand. The force is the biceps muscle when the elbow is flexed.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Basic Biomechanics: Levers (www.aaronswansonpt.com)
Content: ## Mechanical Advantage in Biomechanics

It may seem confusing that most of the muscles in the human body are 3rd class levers, since these levers are at a mechanical disadvantage in terms of effort versus load. However, this only holds true in terms of resistance. The opposite is true when you consider the distal lever displacement. A small arc of motion proximally at the muscle insertion will create large angular displacement and velocity distally. Since most human movement is aimed at maximizing angular displacement of a distal segment through space, the use of 3rd class levers for is very efficient.

This creates a relationship between the lever arm distance, distal angular displacement/velocity, and torque production. The shorter the lever arm of the effort force (decreased mechanical advantage), the greater angular displacement and angular velocity of the distal end of the lever for a given arc of displacement of the effort force. The larger the lever arm of the effort force (increased mechanical advantage), the increased torque production.

This lever arm and force/torque production relationship needs to be taken into consideration when assessing movement and prescribing interventions. For example, applying a 5 pound weight at the distal end of a lever during a scaption/SLR exercise creates a mechanical disadvantage for the supraspinatus/illiopsoas. This results in the muscle being overloaded in attempt to create the amount of torque necessary for the distal angular displacement.

Document ID: 2
Title: Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Content: Bones, ligaments, and muscles are the structures that form levers in the body to create human movement. In simple terms, a joint (where two or more bones join together) forms the axis (or fulcrum), and the muscles crossing the joint apply the force to move a weight or resistance. Levers are typically labeled as first class, second class, or third class. All three types are found in the body, but most levers in the human body are third class.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Content: There are numerous third-class levers in the human body; one example can be illustrated in the elbow joint (figure 1.23b). The joint is the axis (fulcrum). The resistance (weight) is the forearm, wrist, and hand. The force is the biceps muscle when the elbow is flexed.

Document ID: 4
Title: 基本生物力学：杠杆（www.aaronswansonpt.com）
Content: ##生物力学机械优势

令人困惑的是，人体中的大多数肌肉都是第三类杠杆，因为这些杠杆在努力与负载方面处于机械劣势。但是，这仅在抵抗方面是正确的。当您考虑远端杠杆位移时，情况恰恰相反。在肌肉插入处的近端运动弧度将在远端产生较大的角位移和速度。由于大多数人类运动旨在最大化远端段通过空间的角移位，因此使用3类杆的使用非常有效。

这在杠杆臂距离，远端角位移/速度和扭矩产生之间产生了关系。努力力的杠杆臂较短（降低了机械优势），对于给定的努力置换的给定弧线，杆的远端远端的角置换和角速度更大。努力力的杠杆臂越大（机械优势提高），扭矩产生增加。

在评估运动和处方干预措施时，需要考虑这种杠杆臂和力/扭矩生产关系。例如，在割/SLR练习期间，在杠杆的远端施加5磅重的重量会对上张/illiopsoas造成机械劣势。这导致肌肉过载以创造远端角位移所需的扭矩量。
---

Integral calculus provides an exact means of calculating the area under the curve of a mathematical function. Integration has a wide range of applications in physics and engineering.

claim: Google Fiber 是 Google 于 2010 年推出的光纤到户宽带服务，主打最高 1000 Mbps 的高速连接，并采用简单的月度全包计费
question_src: 什么是Google纤维，它会在美国以外生长吗？
all_claims: Google Fiber 是 Google 于 2010 年推出的光纤到户宽带服务，主打最高 1000 Mbps 的高速连接，并采用简单的月度全包计费[1]。
目前该服务仅在美国 18 个城市运营，包括亚特兰大、奥斯汀、丹佛和旧金山等，并且自 2016 年起大部分扩张被“暂停”，过去四年仅新增爱荷华州西德莫因这一处城市[1]。
项目自 2016 年搁置并裁撤了许多相关岗位，扩张脚步显著放缓[2]。
针对国际市场，Google Fiber 团队明确表示“目前没有计划在国际上扩展 Google Fiber”，因此短期内不会进入英国或其他国家[3]。
综合来看，Google Fiber 提供极高速且相对优惠的网络体验，但其覆盖面仍局限美国少数城市，未来重点更可能是巩固现有地区而非跨国扩张。
claims_retained: Google Fiber 是 Google 于 2010 年推出的光纤到户宽带服务，主打最高 1000 Mbps 的高速连接，并采用简单的月度全包计费[1]。

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: “什么是Google Fiber？”：您需要了解有关Google高速互联网服务的所有信息（www.businessinsider.com）
Content: Google Fiber是一项宽带互联网服务，Google目前正在美国的18个城市部署。
*该服务是值得注意的，因为它的高速速度高达1000 Mbps，并采用友好的月份全包定价计划。
*尽管该网络最初有希望，但Google还是停止了纤维的扩展，超出了目前的18个城市，并且尤其是将纤维从试图部署服务的几个城市中拉出。
*访问Business Insider的技术参考库获取更多故事。


Google Fiber是Google的基于光纤的宽带互联网服务，该服务于2010年首次亮相。它旨在为特定城市的企业和个人提供高速连通性。


至少这是目标。尽管Google似乎打算在整个美国推出Google Fiber，但该公司“暂停”了其大部分扩展计划，在过去四年中仅增加了一个新城市 - 他们在2020年7月宣布，纤维将会来到IA的西梅因，但几年来都不会准备好。


目前，在全国18个地点提供Google Fiber服务。


## Google Fiber当前运行的位置


[图像]


您可以访问Google Fiber网站以检查其可用性并注册该服务。戴夫·约翰逊（Dave Johnson）/商业内部人士


该服务目前正在包括佐治亚州亚特兰大在内的18个城市开展或推出运营；德克萨斯州奥斯汀；北卡罗来纳州夏洛特；伊利诺伊州芝加哥；科罗拉多州丹佛；加利福尼亚州旧金山；和西雅图，华盛顿。
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Google Fiber Internet: Coverage & Availability Map (broadbandnow.com)
Content: Google Fiber mainly focuses on urban areas where existing fiber and city regulations make it possible to install FTTH (Fiber to the Home) rapidly. The Google Fiber project has been on hold since 2016, when the company stopped expanding and reportedly cut many jobs related to the project.
---

Title: When is Google fibre coming to the uk or are they not bring it to the uk? (support.google.com)
Content: When is Google fibre coming to the uk or are they not bring it to the uk?

At this time we have no plans to expand Google Fiber internationally.


- Robert, the Google Fiber team
